page.title: 02Employment in Balmullo Area
page.content:
The area which we have studied is mainly agricultural land. Much of it is arable land and some is used as pasture for cattle and sheep. However, a large area is used for growing fruit, particularly raspberries and strawberries. This is one of the things for which Balmullo is best known locally. In fact, at one time there were 27 market gardens in and around the village! Now there is only one, but local farms grow fruit on a large scale.
The only industry in the village takes place at the Quarry and the Smithy. Thus most employment for those who are not involved in farming is at R.A.F. Leuchars or in towns within travelling distance. However, some residents work further afield e.g. on oil rigs or abroad.
